events.message: The claimant reported a collision involving their car and another vehicle at a busy intersection yesterday afternoon.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident after reviewing initial reports mentioning the car was hit on the driver's side.
An experienced claims agent specializing in vehicle accidents was assigned to handle this case promptly and efficiently.
The claimant received confirmation that their auto accident claim has been acknowledged by the insurance company.
Documents including the police report, photos of the vehicle damage, and repair estimates were requested to proceed with the evaluation.
The claimant successfully submitted all requested documents, including detailed photos and the official police report.
The insurer began an investigation into the circumstances of the vehicle collision to assess liability and damages.
Investigation concluded with findings that confirm the claimant was not at fault and damage estimates have been verified.
A fair settlement offer was proposed based on repair costs and the claimant’s coverage terms.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the settlement proposal and the communication throughout the claim process.
The claim was officially approved by the claims manager following acceptance of the proposed settlement by the insured.
A payment covering the agreed repair costs was issued to the claimant’s preferred bank account promptly.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after payment issuance and final confirmation from the claimant.
All documentation and case files related to the vehicle collision claim were archived for future reference.
